Still consulting (it's sweet), starting a gig?  Well, always trying out new things
It's Django for all you Python nerds

Yo @bradmiller
yeah was asking these guys for chat ideas. turns out this is a y combinator startup.
Oh yeah!  Forgot to mention, @bradmiller and I got into the YellowAPI developer program so we'll be finishing off Reservely shortly
There's also HipChat, which is more designed as an in-house tool similar to Basecamp. This one's designed to be more of a free-for-all, I think.
I thought campfire would have been the ideal but it costs $$$.  I like one can create separate rooms as needed.  So there could be a MercuryGrove hangout room or whatever
@phi1rene Yo!  I think the person who came up with this was an IRC nut.
@phi1rene How's the embedded life?
yeah it's not too far off
The embedded life is releasing to public soon... next week I think! ( we have a few marketing guys that deal with that ) What about you? still consulting or starting a gig?!
I feel like I'm hanging around on irc... hahaha Hi guys!
we'll be interviewing in a couple of months :P
I thought "Reserverly" was about to get funded. I was even looking to get hired by you guys... haha
This OmniFocus software has got to be one of the powerful pieces of software I've ever used.
@myusuf3 For real.  Is there another tool that everyone used that can a) stay true to focus on what the community is interested in? and b) Maintain a history
From a different perspective, since the Startup Ottawa type people aren't in any sort of physical or digital community (maybe very loosely and splintered on Twitter), why not start here?
@jevy +1
they are not.
.. after Microsoft Bob of course: http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/1/14/Microsoft_Bob.PNG
although, no real history support
Only reason I would come back to use it if people were on it; like they are on IRC
very cool though.
I like this tool. I do, it just needs everyone to use it to become useful
I took a quick look at the API, and it should be pretty easy to write a native client
Can be done via a robot posting a page
I would like more options for native clients. IRC has the advantage of lots of clients

Her reason: "About two years ago I was using IRC almost every day to communicate at work and with friends. For the 2009 Django Dash, I helped design and build a web-based IRC client called Leafy Chat with Alex Gaynor and Chris Wanstrath. Soon after building the IRC-based Leafy Chat, it started to bother me that IRC was so complicated and nerdy. Even with the Leafy Chat web client, I kept mulling over how much the experience could be improved." -- http://blog.leahculver.com/2011/02/convore-group-chat-for-everyone.html
Oh neat!  Looks like @alanfalloon can use and IRC app.  There's a bot that connects IRC up to other APIs via XMPP.  http://code.google.com/p/jsonbot/
Really slick idea
Campfire is a really nice alternative option though, but cost $50/m for 25 users or something
that's great news about reservely
is this a legislated deal to use Roger's cable lines?
Just noticed that TekSavvy cable internet is now available. Yes!
i'm always looking for new ways to express my pent up rage towards rogers
when we look at other SDKs like the soon-to-be-released Blackberry, it will be things like this that you look for because they make very complex apps much more tractable

Brierwood recently completed this very cool iPad app: http://itunes.apple.com/ca/app/mcdwiff/id434946411?mt=8  -- it really highlights the power of the iOS platform and one of its core components (CATiledLayer); otherwise this project would have been prohibitively expensive for the client
That looks amazing
The price point looks low for such a specialized piece of SW
